content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the original and simplified passages

The passage:
We introduce Ignition: an end-to-end neural network architecture for training unconstrained self-driving vehicles in simulated environments.

DC: University student
ILT: Medium
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The complexity level of the passage is relatively high, as it includes technical terms and concepts related to neural networks and self-driving vehicles that may not be easily understood by a university student without a background in those fields. The phrase "end-to-end neural network architecture" and "unconstrained self-driving vehicles in simulated environments" contribute to its elevated complexity.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage
The section "end-to-end neural network architecture" is a complicated part of the passage.
Simplify this section
"end-to-end neural network architecture" can be simplified to "a complete neural network system."
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
We introduce Ignition: a complete neural network system for training unconstrained self-driving vehicles in simulated environments.
Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original

In the updated passage, the simplification "a complete neural network system" may not fully convey the specific concept of "end-to-end neural network architecture," which emphasizes the holistic design of the neural network from input to output. 

**Information Loss:**
1. Loss of the specific term "end-to-end" which indicates a particular architecture type.
2. The implication of the system's design focus might be less clear.

**Severity of Information Loss:** Medium. While the general idea of a neural network system is maintained, the specific architectural detail and implications of the term "end-to-end" are lost, which could be significant in a technical context. 

Since this severity is higher than the ILT, the changes will be rejected.
What is the highest severity level identified? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Revert the last proposed change. In further iterations you may still attempt to simplify this section in other ways
We introduce Ignition: an end-to-end neural network architecture for training unconstrained self-driving vehicles in simulated environments.
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The complexity level of the passage is still high, as it includes specialized terminology such as "end-to-end neural network architecture" and "unconstrained self-driving vehicles," which may not be fully understood by a university student without specific knowledge in those areas. The passage retains technical concepts that contribute to its elevated complexity.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage
The section "unconstrained self-driving vehicles" is a complicated part of the passage.
Simplify this section
"unconstrained self-driving vehicles" can be simplified to "self-driving vehicles with no restrictions."
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
We introduce Ignition: an end-to-end neural network architecture for training self-driving vehicles with no restrictions in simulated environments.
Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original

In the updated passage, the simplification "self-driving vehicles with no restrictions" may lose some specificity regarding the intended meaning of "unconstrained." 

**Information Loss:**
1. The term "unconstrained" implies not only the absence of restrictions but also suggests a focus on operating in a variety of environments and scenarios, which might not be captured by the simplified phrase.

**Severity of Information Loss:** Medium. While the general concept of self-driving vehicles is retained, the nuances associated with "unconstrained" might not be fully conveyed, which could affect understanding in a technical context.

Since this severity is higher than the ILT, the changes will be rejected.
What is the highest severity level identified? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Revert the last proposed change. In further iterations you may still attempt to simplify this section in other ways
We introduce Ignition: an end-to-end neural network architecture for training unconstrained self-driving vehicles in simulated environments.
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The complexity level of the passage remains high, as it still includes specialized terminology such as "end-to-end neural network architecture" and "unconstrained self-driving vehicles," which may not be easily understood by a university student lacking specific background knowledge in these areas. The passage continues to contain technical concepts that contribute to its elevated complexity.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage
The section "simulated environments" is a complicated part of the passage.
Simplify this section
"simulated environments" can be simplified to "artificial settings."
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
We introduce Ignition: an end-to-end neural network architecture for training unconstrained self-driving vehicles in artificial settings.
Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original

In the updated passage, the simplification "artificial settings" instead of "simulated environments" may lead to some loss in the specific meaning associated with "simulated environments."

**Information Loss:**
1. The term "simulated environments" specifically refers to computer-generated scenarios that mimic real-world conditions for testing algorithms, while "artificial settings" might not carry the same technical meaning.
2. The context of simulation for training purposes could be less clear.

**Severity of Information Loss:** Medium. The fundamental idea is retained, but the specific context of simulation used in the training of self-driving vehicles may not be fully communicated, which could impact understanding in a technical context.

Since this severity is higher than the ILT, the changes will be rejected.
What is the highest severity level identified? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Revert the last proposed change. In further iterations you may still attempt to simplify this section in other ways
We introduce Ignition: an end-to-end neural network architecture for training unconstrained self-driving vehicles in simulated environments.
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The complexity level of the passage is still high, as it contains specialized terminology and concepts such as "end-to-end neural network architecture," "unconstrained self-driving vehicles," and "simulated environments." These terms may not be easily understood by a university student without specific knowledge in the relevant fields, which keeps the overall complexity elevated.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage
The section "end-to-end neural network architecture" is a complicated part of the passage.
Simplify this section
"end-to-end neural network architecture" can be simplified to "a full neural network design."
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
We introduce Ignition: a full neural network design for training unconstrained self-driving vehicles in simulated environments.
Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original

In the updated passage, the simplification "a full neural network design" instead of "end-to-end neural network architecture" may lead to some degree of information loss.

**Information Loss:**
1. The term "end-to-end" specifically refers to a particular approach within neural network architectures that involves processing data from input to output in a single, unified model. This nuance might not be captured in "full neural network design."
2. The term "architecture" conveys more than just design; it suggests a structured arrangement and functionality that is integral to the design of neural networks.

**Severity of Information Loss:** Medium. The general idea of a neural network is still conveyed, but critical aspects of its design and approach are lost, which could be significant in a technical context.

Since this severity is higher than the ILT, the changes will be rejected.
What is the highest severity level identified? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Revert the last proposed change. In further iterations you may still attempt to simplify this section in other ways
We introduce Ignition: an end-to-end neural network architecture for training unconstrained self-driving vehicles in simulated environments.
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The complexity level of the passage remains high, as it continues to feature specialized terminology like "end-to-end neural network architecture," "unconstrained self-driving vehicles," and "simulated environments." These technical concepts may not be readily understood by a university student without specific knowledge in these areas, maintaining the overall elevated complexity.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage
The section "unconstrained self-driving vehicles" is a complicated part of the passage.
Simplify this section
"unconstrained self-driving vehicles" can be simplified to "self-driving vehicles without limits."
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
We introduce Ignition: an end-to-end neural network architecture for training self-driving vehicles without limits in simulated environments.
Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original

In the updated passage, the simplification "self-driving vehicles without limits" instead of "unconstrained self-driving vehicles" may lead to some loss of nuance.

**Information Loss:**
1. The term "unconstrained" in the original context implies not only the absence of limits but also suggests a focus on the vehicle's ability to operate in diverse and varying real-world conditions, which may not be fully expressed by "without limits."
2. The simplification may lack the technical connotation and specificity associated with the original term in the context of autonomous vehicle design.

**Severity of Information Loss:** Medium. While the core idea of self-driving vehicles is preserved, important nuances related to their capabilities and operational context are potentially lost.

Since this severity is higher than the ILT, the changes will be rejected.
What is the highest severity level identified? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Revert the last proposed change. In further iterations you may still attempt to simplify this section in other ways
We introduce Ignition: an end-to-end neural network architecture for training unconstrained self-driving vehicles in simulated environments.
Provide the final version of the simplified passage
We introduce Ignition: an end-to-end neural network architecture for training unconstrained self-driving vehicles in simulated environments.
